channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Regions - Asia
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2023 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
item.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recovery.

item.title: Afghanistan
Hong Kong
Japan
North Korea
Pakistan
Sri Lanka
Taiwan
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
item.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

item.title: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
item.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat.

item.title: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
item.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

item.title: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
item.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

item.title: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
item.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

item.title: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
item.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

item.title: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
item.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Sri Lanka reopens borders to international travelers
item.description: The island nation of Sri Lanka is now open to tourists from all countries.

item.title: Singapore Airlines plans for a fully vaccinated crew
item.description: Singapore's national carrier is hoping to become the world's first airline to get all of its crew members vaccinated against Covid-19.

item.title: Aung San Suu Kyi Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Aung San Suu Kyi to learn more about the Burmese politician, activist and Nobel Peace Prize winner.

item.title: Rescuers try to save boy, 10, trapped in concrete pile
item.description: Rescuers in Vietnam were desperately trying to free a 10-year boy on Monday two days after he fell into the narrow open shaft of a concrete pile at a construction site on New Year's Eve.

item.title: Kim calls for exponential increase in North Korea's nuclear arsenal
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is calling for an "exponential increase" in his country's nuclear weapons arsenal in response to what he claims are threats from South Korea and the United States, Pyongyang's state media reported Sunday.

item.title: Tibet Fast Facts
item.description: Read Tibet Fast Facts at CNN and learn more about this autonomous region within the People's Republic of China.

item.title: North Korea fires Kim's No. 2 military official
item.description: North Korea has fired Pak Jong Chon, the second most powerful military official after leader Kim Jong Un, state media reported.

item.title: Japan's emperor gives first live New Year address since pandemic began
item.description: Japanese Emperor Naruhito greeted well-wishers at the Imperial Palace in Tokyo for the first time in three years on Monday, reviving an annual New Year tradition that was paused during the Covid pandemic.
